agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Homeland Security & Public Safety TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Wednesday, March 6, 2019 PLACE: E2.016 CHAIR: Rep. Poncho Nevárez HB 8 Neave Relating to the statute of limitations for certain sexual offenses and the collection, analysis, and preservation of evidence of sexual assault and other sex offenses. HB 616 Neave Relating to compensation for a portion of a forensic medical examination of a sexual assault survivor and for the evidence collection kit required for the examination. HB 785 Shaheen Relating to the execution of a warrant issued for certain individuals who violate a condition of release on parole or to mandatory supervision. HB 971 Clardy | et al. Relating to proficiency certification of law enforcement officers with military service. HB 979 Hernandez Relating to the creation of DNA records for certain defendants for inclusion in the DNA database system. HB 1177 Phelan | et al. Relating to carrying a handgun during a state of disaster. The order in which bills will be heard is at the discretion of the chair. If testifying, please register at one of the kiosks located in the Capitol Extension. ****There will be a 3 minute time limit on testimony**** NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
